Description: Sherd from the shoulder of a jar; red-brown ware with occasional white grits and flecks of mica; red burnished exterior surface with painted black stripes and an incised pattern
Bibliographic references: Reade & Burleigh 1978a / The 'Ali cemetery: old excavations, ivory and radiocarbon dating (pl. 34b)
Nayeem M A 1992a / Bahrain (fig 18, middle row, left)
Mackay E 1929a / Bahrein and Hemamieh (pl. VI inset, upper)
Condition: Incomplete; upper part of object only; lower body lost.
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
